spells.name: Alarm
spells.description: You set an alarm against intrusion. Choose a door, a window, or an area within range that is no larger than a 20-foot Cube. Until the spell ends, an alarm alerts you whenever a creature touches or enters the warded area. You can designate creatures that won't set off the alarm. Choose mental or audible alarm.

spells.name: Armor of Agathys
spells.description: Protective magical cold surrounds you. You gain 5 Temporary Hit Points. If a creature hits you with a melee attack roll before the spell ends, the creature takes 5 Cold damage.
spells.higher_levels: The Temporary Hit Points and Cold damage both increase by 5 for each spell slot level above 1.

spells.name: Bane
spells.description: Up to three creatures of your choice that you can see within range must make Charisma saving throws. Whenever a target fails the save and makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target subtracts 1d4 from the attack roll or saving throw.
spells.higher_levels: You can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1.

spells.name: Bless
spells.description: You bless up to three creatures of your choice within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the roll.
spells.higher_levels: You can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1.

spells.name: Burning Hands
spells.description: A thin sheet of flames shoots forth from your fingertips. Each creature in a 15-foot Cone makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 3d6 Fire damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. Flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried start burning.
spells.higher_levels: The damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1.

spells.name: Charm Person
spells.description: One Humanoid you can see within range makes a Wisdom saving throw. It has Advantage if you or your allies are fighting it. On a failed save, it has the Charmed condition until the spell ends or until you or your allies damage it. The Charmed creature regards you as a friendly acquaintance. When the spell ends, the creature knows it was Charmed by you.
spells.higher_levels: You can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1.

spells.name: Chromatic Orb
spells.description: You hurl an orb of energy at a creature within range. Choose Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Poison, or Thunder for the type of orb you create, then make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes 3d8 damage of the chosen type. If you roll the same number on two or more of the d8s, the orb leaps to a different target within 30 feet of the original, requiring a new attack roll.
spells.higher_levels: The damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1.

spells.name: Color Spray
spells.description: You launch a dazzling array of flashing, colored light. Each creature in a 15-foot Cone must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature has the Blinded condition until the end of your next turn.

spells.name: Command
spells.description: You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. Common commands include Approach, Drop, Flee, Grovel, or Halt.
spells.higher_levels: You can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1.

spells.name: Compelled Duel
spells.description: You try to compel a creature into a duel. One creature that you can see within range must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has Disadvantage on attack rolls against creatures other than you, and it must make a Wisdom saving throw each time it tries to move to a space that is more than 30 feet away from you.

spells.name: Comprehend Languages
spells.description: For the duration, you understand the literal meaning of any language that you hear or see signed. You also understand any written language that you see, but you must be touching the surface on which the words are written. This spell doesn't decode symbols, ciphers, or secret messages.

spells.name: Create or Destroy Water

components.material: a drop of water or a few grains of sand

spells.description: You either create or destroy water. Create Water: You create up to 10 gallons of clean water within range in an open container. Alternatively, water falls as rain in a 30-foot Cube within range. Destroy Water: You destroy up to 10 gallons of water in an open container within range. Alternatively, you destroy fog in a 30-foot Cube within range.
spells.higher_levels: Create or destroy 10 additional gallons of water, or the size of the cube increases by 5 feet, for each slot level above 1.

spells.name: Cure Wounds
spells.description: A creature you touch regains a number of Hit Points equal to 2d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.
spells.higher_levels: The healing increases by 2d8 for each slot level above 1.

spells.name: Detect Evil and Good
spells.description: For the duration, you sense the presence of Aberrations, Celestials, Elementals, Fey, Fiends, and Undead within 30 feet of yourself. You also sense whether the Hallow spell is active there and, if so, where.

spells.name: Detect Magic
spells.description: For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense magic in this way, you can take a Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and you learn what school of magic it is, if any.

spells.name: Detect Poison and Disease
spells.description: For the duration, you can sense the location of any poisons, poisonous or venomous creatures, and magical contagions within 30 feet of you. You also identify the kind of poison, creature, or contagion in each case.

spells.name: Disguise Self
spells.description: You make yourself—including your clothing, armor, weapons, and other belongings on your person—look different until the spell ends. You can seem up to 1 foot shorter or taller and can appear heavier or lighter. To discern that you are disguised, a creature must use its action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC.

spells.name: Dissonant Whispers
spells.description: You whisper a discordant melody that only one creature of your choice within range can hear. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 3d6 Psychic damage and must immediately use its Reaction to move as far as its Speed allows away from you. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.
spells.higher_levels: The damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1.

spells.name: Divine Favor
spells.description: Until the spell ends, your attacks with weapons deal an extra 1d4 Radiant damage on a hit.

spells.name: Divine Smite
spells.casting_time: Bonus Action, which you take immediately after hitting a target
spells.description: The target takes an extra 2d8 Radiant damage from the attack. The damage increases by 1d8 if the target is a Fiend or an Undead.
spells.higher_levels: The damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1.
spells.notes_2024: Divine Smite is now a spell rather than a class feature, cast as a Bonus Action after hitting with a weapon attack.

spells.name: Ensnaring Strike
spells.casting_time: Bonus Action, which you take immediately after hitting with a weapon
spells.description: The target of the triggering attack must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have the Restrained condition until the spell ends. While Restrained by this spell, the target takes 1d6 Piercing damage at the start of each of its turns. The target or a creature within 5 feet of it can use an action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC to end the spell early.
spells.higher_levels: The damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1.

spells.name: Entangle
spells.description: Grasping weeds and vines sprout from the ground in a 20-foot square starting from a point within range. For the duration, these plants turn the ground in the area into Difficult Terrain. Each creature in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have the Restrained condition. A creature can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC, freeing itself or another creature within reach.

spells.name: Expeditious Retreat
spells.description: You take the Dash action, and until the spell ends, you can take the Dash action as a Bonus Action.

spells.name: Faerie Fire
spells.description: Objects in a 20-foot Cube within range are outlined in blue, green, or violet light (your choice). Each creature in the Cube is also outlined if it fails a Dexterity saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed Dim Light in a 10-foot radius and can't benefit from the Invisible condition.

spells.name: False Life
spells.description: You gain 2d4 + 4 Temporary Hit Points.
spells.higher_levels: You gain 5 additional Temporary Hit Points for each slot level above 1.

spells.name: Feather Fall
spells.casting_time: Reaction, which you take when you or a creature within 60 feet of you falls

components.material: a small feather or piece of down

spells.description: Choose up to five falling creatures within range. A falling creature's rate of descent slows to 60 feet per round until the spell ends. If a creature lands before the spell ends, it takes no damage from the fall, and the spell ends for that creature.

spells.name: Find Familiar

components.material: burning incense worth 10+ GP, which the spell consumes

spells.description: You gain the service of a familiar, a spirit that takes an animal form you choose: Bat, Cat, Crab, Frog, Hawk, Lizard, Octopus, Owl, Poisonous Snake, Quipper, Rat, Raven, Seahorse, Spider, or Weasel. The familiar obeys your commands and can be dismissed or resummons.

spells.name: Fog Cloud
spells.description: You create a 20-foot-radius Sphere of fog centered on a point within range. The Sphere is Heavily Obscured.
spells.higher_levels: The radius of the fog increases by 20 feet for each slot level above 1.

spells.name: Goodberry
spells.description: Ten berries appear in your hand. A creature can use a Bonus Action to eat one berry, which restores 1 Hit Point and provides enough nourishment to sustain a creature for one day. The berries lose their potency when the spell ends.

spells.name: Grease
spells.description: Slick grease covers a 10-foot square area on a level surface within range and turns it into Difficult Terrain. When the grease appears, each creature standing in its area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall Prone. A creature that enters the area or ends its turn there must also succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall Prone.

spells.name: Guiding Bolt
spells.description: A flash of light streaks toward a creature of your choice within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 4d6 Radiant damage, and the next attack roll made against this target before the end of your next turn has Advantage.
spells.higher_levels: The damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1.

spells.name: Hail of Thorns
spells.casting_time: Bonus Action, which you take immediately after hitting with a Ranged weapon
spells.description: As you hit the target, a rain of thorns bursts from your Ranged weapon or ammunition. The target and every creature within 5 feet of it must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 1d10 Piercing damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.
spells.higher_levels: The damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 1 (to a maximum of 6d10).

spells.name: Healing Word
spells.description: A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains Hit Points equal to 2d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.
spells.higher_levels: The healing increases by 2d4 for each slot level above 1.

spells.name: Hellish Rebuke
spells.casting_time: Reaction, which you take in response to taking damage from a creature that you can see within 60 feet of you
spells.description: The creature that damaged you is momentarily surrounded by hellish flames. It must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 2d10 Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.
spells.higher_levels: The damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 1.

spells.name: Heroism
spells.description: A willing creature you touch is imbued with bravery. Until the spell ends, the creature has Immunity to the Frightened condition and gains Temporary Hit Points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier at the start of each of its turns.
spells.higher_levels: You can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1.

spells.name: Hex

components.material: the petrified eye of a newt

spells.description: You place a curse on a creature that you can see within range. Until the spell ends, you deal an extra 1d6 Necrotic damage to the target whenever you hit it with an attack roll. Also, choose one ability. The target has Disadvantage on ability checks made with the chosen ability. If the target drops to 0 HP before this spell ends, you can take a Bonus Action to curse a new creature.
spells.higher_levels: Slot 3-4: Concentration up to 8 hours. Slot 5+: Concentration up to 24 hours.

spells.name: Hunter's Mark
spells.description: You magically mark one creature you can see within range as your quarry. Until the spell ends, you deal an extra 1d6 Force damage to the target whenever you hit it with an attack roll. You also have Advantage on any Wisdom (Perception or Survival) check you make to find it. If the target drops to 0 Hit Points, you can take a Bonus Action to mark a new creature.
spells.higher_levels: Slot 3-4: Concentration up to 8 hours. Slot 5+: Concentration up to 24 hours.
spells.notes_2024: Hunter's Mark now deals Force damage instead of the weapon's damage type, and can no longer be removed by Dispel Magic while you have the Mark active.

spells.name: Identify
spells.description: You choose one object that you must touch throughout the casting of the spell. If it is a magic item or some other magic-imbued object, you learn its properties and how to use them, whether it requires attunement, and how many charges it has, if any.

spells.name: Illusory Script

components.material: lead-based ink worth 10+ GP, which the spell consumes

spells.description: You write on parchment, paper, or another suitable material and imbue it with a potent illusion. To you and any creatures you designate, the writing appears normal. To all others, the writing appears as a different script or as an unintelligible message.

spells.name: Inflict Wounds
spells.description: A creature you touch makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 2d10 Necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.
spells.higher_levels: The damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 1.
spells.notes_2024: Inflict Wounds now requires a Constitution save instead of a melee spell attack.

spells.name: Jump
spells.description: You touch a willing creature. Once on each of its turns until the spell ends, that creature can jump up to 30 feet by spending 10 feet of movement.

spells.name: Longstrider
spells.description: You touch a creature. The target's Speed increases by 10 feet until the spell ends.
spells.higher_levels: You can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1.

spells.name: Mage Armor
spells.description: You touch a willing creature who isn't wearing armor. Until the spell ends, the target's base AC becomes 13 plus its Dexterity modifier. The spell ends early if the target puts on armor or if you dismiss the spell.

spells.name: Magic Missile
spells.description: You create three glowing darts of magical force. Each dart hits a creature of your choice that you can see within range. A dart deals 1d4 + 1 Force damage to its target. The darts all strike simultaneously, and you can direct them to hit one creature or several.
spells.higher_levels: The spell creates one more dart for each slot level above 1.

spells.name: Protection from Evil and Good

components.material: holy water, which the spell consumes

spells.description: Until the spell ends, one willing creature you touch is protected against Aberrations, Celestials, Elementals, Fey, Fiends, and Undead. The protection grants: those creature types have Disadvantage on attack rolls against the target, and the target can't be Charmed, Frightened, or possessed by them.

spells.name: Purify Food and Drink
spells.description: All nonmagical food and drink within a 5-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point of your choice within range is purified and rendered free of poison and disease.

spells.name: Sanctuary
spells.description: You ward a creature within range. Until the spell ends, any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack roll or a damaging spell must first make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature must choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This spell doesn't protect the warded creature from area effects. The spell ends early if the warded creature makes an attack roll, casts a spell, or deals damage.

spells.name: Searing Smite
spells.casting_time: Bonus Action, which you take immediately after hitting a target
spells.description: The target of the triggering attack takes an extra 1d6 Fire damage from the attack. At the start of each of its turns until the spell ends, the target takes 1d6 Fire damage and then makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the spell continues. On a successful save, the spell ends.
spells.higher_levels: All the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1.

spells.name: Shield
spells.casting_time: Reaction, which you take when you are hit by an attack roll or targeted by Magic Missile
spells.description: An invisible barrier of magical force appears and protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from Magic Missile.

spells.name: Shield of Faith

components.material: parchment with a scrap of holy text

spells.description: A shimmering field appears and surrounds a creature of your choice within range, granting it a +2 bonus to AC for the duration.

spells.name: Silent Image
spells.description: You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 15-foot Cube. The image appears at a spot within range and lasts for the duration. It seems completely real, but it is a visual only. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion.

spells.name: Sleep

components.material: a pinch of sand, rose petals, or a cricket

spells.description: Each creature of your choice in a 5-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the Incapacitated condition until the spell ends, the sleeper takes damage, or someone uses an action to shake the sleeper awake.
spells.higher_levels: The Sphere's radius increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 1.
spells.notes_2024: Sleep is now Concentration and requires a Wisdom save, rather than using hit point totals.

spells.name: Speak with Animals
spells.description: You gain the ability to comprehend and verbally communicate with Beasts for the duration. The knowledge and awareness of many Beasts is limited by their intelligence, but at minimum, Beasts can give you information about nearby locations and monsters.

spells.name: Tasha's Hideous Laughter
spells.description: A creature of your choice that you can see within range perceives everything as hilariously funny and falls into fits of laughter. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the Prone and Incapacitated conditions for the duration. A creature with an Intelligence of 4 or less isn't affected. At the end of each of its turns, the target makes another Wisdom saving throw. The target has Advantage on the save if it's triggered by damage.

spells.name: Thunderwave
spells.description: You unleash a wave of thunderous force. Each creature in a 15-foot Cube originating from you makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 2d8 Thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet away from you. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.
spells.higher_levels: The damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1.

spells.name: Unseen Servant

components.material: a bit of string and a piece of wood

spells.description: This spell creates an invisible, mindless, shapeless, Medium force that performs simple tasks at your command until the spell ends. The servant springs into existence in an unoccupied space on the ground within range.

spells.name: Witch Bolt

components.material: a twig from a tree struck by lightning

spells.description: A beam of crackling energy lances toward a creature within range, forming a sustained arc of lightning between you and the target. Make a ranged spell attack against that creature. On a hit, the target takes 2d12 Lightning damage. On each of your subsequent turns, you can take a Bonus Action to deal 1d12 Lightning damage to the target automatically. The spell ends if the target is ever outside the spell's range or if it has Total Cover from you.
spells.higher_levels: The initial damage increases by 1d12 for each slot level above 1.

spells.name: Wrathful Smite
spells.casting_time: Bonus Action, which you take immediately after hitting with a Melee weapon
spells.description: The target of the triggering attack takes an extra 1d6 Necrotic damage. The target must also make a Wisdom saving throw or have the Frightened condition until the spell ends. At the end of each of its turns, the Frightened target repeats the save, ending the spell on a success.
spells.higher_levels: The damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1.
